messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:38): oh Bj??rn had his spiel again about XMLHttpRequest not having a test suite
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:38): trololol
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (18:42): I thought you wrote a test suite for XHR
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:43): yeah 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 pointed that out
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:48): oh, test suites
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:49): I need to look at my notes about invalid EventSource tests
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:50): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: but in any case, thanks for writing tests!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:50): 6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf, they've been around for a year now...
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:51): xhr and eventsource?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:51): do you happen to have tests for xhr.timeout already?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:51): (someone is implementing that)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:52): I have not written tests for any of the new features and I don't think I should
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:52): It's bad to write both the spec and the tests
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:00): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, so what should I recommend instead of replaceWholeText?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:05): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, parentNode.normalize() and then setting data?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:06): or maybe just say to use textContent
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:09): graag gedaan
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (19:12): http://www.onderhond.com/blog/work/rel-next-prev-google
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (19:22): "verbose"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:23): also seems like what Google is doing is the whole point behind having such attribute values
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:23): that you can offer different UI
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (19:27): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: ooh, second time an "assistant-resolved" bug got escalated :-)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:32): oh hey
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:32): deadline coming up
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:32): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2011May/0162.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:32): sort of forgot about that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:35): 30 bugs to WONTFIX per day :p

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:55): noticed http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=13684 (on event handlers and DOM Events) while looking through those bugs; been meaning to write about that so that was nice
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:04): Oh, it's already text/vtt I see

06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (20:07): i sort of like the idea of dropping "web" from webvtt, simply because there's nothing about it that's web-specific, and having "web" in there could (minorly) hinder adoption
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (20:08): only casually, though, it's already had one name change
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (20:10): (on the other hand, "vtt" is slightly less googlable than "webvtt")

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:15): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6, we could still call it WebVTT (although I don't think it's a good idea to prefix specifications with random words such as "X" or "Web"), just not have "Web" become an intrinsic part of the format
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (20:16): if it's baked into the name of the spec, that's what people will call it, so the file header probably doesn't matter much at that point
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (20:17): well, i guess what people end up calling it is out of our hands--if people name the files *.vtt they may call it "vtt" no matter what we do

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:17): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I wanted the signature to be "WEBVTT FILE", it's already been reduced to "WEBVTT". I don't think we should go down even further.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:20): I guess in the end it's just another string, like XMLHttpRequest
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:21): (Not that WEBVTT is that bad ;))
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (20:22): WEBVtt to represent a file format name WebVTT? that's a mind-bender :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:23): hey you can now search in Google+
